messages.id:
Command line interface for Horizon agent. Most of the sub-commands use the Horizon Agent API at the default location http://localhost (see environment Environment Variables section to override this).

Subcommands Description:
  agbot: List and manage Horizon agreement bot resources.
  agreement: List or manage the active or archived agreements this edge node has made with a Horizon agreement bot.
  architecture: Show the architecture of this machine (as defined by Horizon and golang). 
  attribute: List or manage the global attributes that are currently registered on this Horizon edge node.
  deploycheck: Check deployment compatibility.
  dev: Development tools for creation of services.
  env: Show the Horizon Environment Variables.
  eventlog: List the event logs for the current or all registrations.
  exchange: List and manage Horizon Exchange resources.
  key: List and manage keys for signing and verifying services. 
  metering: List or manage the metering (payment) information for the active or archived agreements.
  mms: List and manage Horizon Model Management Service resources.
  node: List and manage general information about this Horizon edge node.
  policy: List and manage policy for this Horizon edge node. 
  reginput: Create an input file template for this pattern that can be used for the 'hzn register' command (once filled in). 
            This examines the services that the specified pattern uses, and determines the node owner input that is required for them. 
  register: Register this edge node with the management hub.
  service: List or manage the services that are currently registered on this Horizon edge node.
  status: Display the current horizon internal status for the node.
  unregister: Unregister and reset this Horizon edge node so that it is ready to be registered again.
  userinput: List or manager the service user inputs that are currently registered on this Horizon edge node.
  util: Utility commands.
  version: Show the Horizon version.
  voucher: List and manage Horizon SDO ownership vouchers.

Environment Variables:
  HORIZON_URL:  Override the URL at which hzn contacts the Horizon Agent API.
      This can facilitate using a remote Horizon Agent via an ssh tunnel.
  HZN_EXCHANGE_URL:  Override the URL that the 'hzn exchange' sub-commands use
      to communicate with the Horizon Exchange, for example
      https://exchange.bluehorizon.network/api/v1. (By default hzn will ask the
      Horizon Agent for the URL.)
  HZN_ORG_ID:  Default value for the 'hzn exchange -o' flag,
      to specify the organization ID'.
  HZN_EXCHANGE_USER_AUTH:  Default value for the 'hzn exchange -u' or 'hzn
	  register -u' flag, in the form '[org/]user:pw'. Notice that HZN_ORG_ID can be set
	  if org is omitted when HZN_EXCHANGE_USER_AUTH is set.
  HZN_FSS_CSSURL:  Override the URL that the 'hzn mms' sub-commands use
      to communicate with the Horizon Model Management Service, for example
      https://exchange.bluehorizon.network/css/. (By default hzn will ask the
      Horizon Agent for the URL.)
  HZN_SDO_SVC_URL:  Override the URL that the 'hzn sdo' sub-commands use
	  to communicate with SDO owner services. (By default hzn will ask the
		Horizon Agent for the URL.)

  All these environment variables and ones mentioned in the command help can be
  specified in user's configuration file: ~/.hzn/hzn.json with JSON format.
  For example:
  {Com____}
messages.message:
Command line interface for Horizon agent. Most of the sub-commands use the Horizon Agent API at the default location http://localhost (see environment Environment Variables section to override this).

Subcommands Description:
  agbot: List and manage Horizon agreement bot resources.
  agreement: List or manage the active or archived agreements this edge node has made with a Horizon agreement bot.
  architecture: Show the architecture of this machine (as defined by Horizon and golang). 
  attribute: List or manage the global attributes that are currently registered on this Horizon edge node.
  deploycheck: Check deployment compatibility.
  dev: Development tools for creation of services.
  env: Show the Horizon Environment Variables.
  eventlog: List the event logs for the current or all registrations.
  exchange: List and manage Horizon Exchange resources.
  key: List and manage keys for signing and verifying services. 
  metering: List or manage the metering (payment) information for the active or archived agreements.
  mms: List and manage Horizon Model Management Service resources.
  node: List and manage general information about this Horizon edge node.
  policy: List and manage policy for this Horizon edge node. 
  reginput: Create an input file template for this pattern that can be used for the 'hzn register' command (once filled in). 
            This examines the services that the specified pattern uses, and determines the node owner input that is required for them. 
  register: Register this edge node with the management hub.
  service: List or manage the services that are currently registered on this Horizon edge node.
  status: Display the current horizon internal status for the node.
  unregister: Unregister and reset this Horizon edge node so that it is ready to be registered again.
  userinput: List or manager the service user inputs that are currently registered on this Horizon edge node.
  util: Utility commands.
  version: Show the Horizon version.
  voucher: List and manage Horizon SDO ownership vouchers.

Environment Variables:
  HORIZON_URL:  Override the URL at which hzn contacts the Horizon Agent API.
      This can facilitate using a remote Horizon Agent via an ssh tunnel.
  HZN_EXCHANGE_URL:  Override the URL that the 'hzn exchange' sub-commands use
      to communicate with the Horizon Exchange, for example
      https://exchange.bluehorizon.network/api/v1. (By default hzn will ask the
      Horizon Agent for the URL.)
  HZN_ORG_ID:  Default value for the 'hzn exchange -o' flag,
      to specify the organization ID'.
  HZN_EXCHANGE_USER_AUTH:  Default value for the 'hzn exchange -u' or 'hzn
	  register -u' flag, in the form '[org/]user:pw'. Notice that HZN_ORG_ID can be set
	  if org is omitted when HZN_EXCHANGE_USER_AUTH is set.
  HZN_FSS_CSSURL:  Override the URL that the 'hzn mms' sub-commands use
      to communicate with the Horizon Model Management Service, for example
      https://exchange.bluehorizon.network/css/. (By default hzn will ask the
      Horizon Agent for the URL.)
  HZN_SDO_SVC_URL:  Override the URL that the 'hzn sdo' sub-commands use
	  to communicate with SDO owner services. (By default hzn will ask the
		Horizon Agent for the URL.)

  All these environment variables and ones mentioned in the command help can be
  specified in user's configuration file: ~/.hzn/hzn.json with JSON format.
  For example:
  {Com____}
messages.translation:
Command line interface for Horizon agent. Most of the sub-commands use the Horizon Agent API at the default location http://localhost (see environment Environment Variables section to override this).

Subcommands Description:
  agbot: List and manage Horizon agreement bot resources.
  agreement: List or manage the active or archived agreements this edge node has made with a Horizon agreement bot.
  architecture: Show the architecture of this machine (as defined by Horizon and golang). 
  attribute: List or manage the global attributes that are currently registered on this Horizon edge node.
  deploycheck: Check deployment compatibility.
  dev: Development tools for creation of services.
  env: Show the Horizon Environment Variables.
  eventlog: List the event logs for the current or all registrations.
  exchange: List and manage Horizon Exchange resources.
  key: List and manage keys for signing and verifying services. 
  metering: List or manage the metering (payment) information for the active or archived agreements.
  mms: List and manage Horizon Model Management Service resources.
  node: List and manage general information about this Horizon edge node.
  policy: List and manage policy for this Horizon edge node. 
  reginput: Create an input file template for this pattern that can be used for the 'hzn register' command (once filled in). 
            This examines the services that the specified pattern uses, and determines the node owner input that is required for them. 
  register: Register this edge node with the management hub.
  service: List or manage the services that are currently registered on this Horizon edge node.
  status: Display the current horizon internal status for the node.
  unregister: Unregister and reset this Horizon edge node so that it is ready to be registered again.
  userinput: List or manager the service user inputs that are currently registered on this Horizon edge node.
  util: Utility commands.
  version: Show the Horizon version.
  voucher: List and manage Horizon SDO ownership vouchers.

Environment Variables:
  HORIZON_URL:  Override the URL at which hzn contacts the Horizon Agent API.
      This can facilitate using a remote Horizon Agent via an ssh tunnel.
  HZN_EXCHANGE_URL:  Override the URL that the 'hzn exchange' sub-commands use
      to communicate with the Horizon Exchange, for example
      https://exchange.bluehorizon.network/api/v1. (By default hzn will ask the
      Horizon Agent for the URL.)
  HZN_ORG_ID:  Default value for the 'hzn exchange -o' flag,
      to specify the organization ID'.
  HZN_EXCHANGE_USER_AUTH:  Default value for the 'hzn exchange -u' or 'hzn
	  register -u' flag, in the form '[org/]user:pw'. Notice that HZN_ORG_ID can be set
	  if org is omitted when HZN_EXCHANGE_USER_AUTH is set.
  HZN_FSS_CSSURL:  Override the URL that the 'hzn mms' sub-commands use
      to communicate with the Horizon Model Management Service, for example
      https://exchange.bluehorizon.network/css/. (By default hzn will ask the
      Horizon Agent for the URL.)
  HZN_SDO_SVC_URL:  Override the URL that the 'hzn sdo' sub-commands use
	  to communicate with SDO owner services. (By default hzn will ask the
		Horizon Agent for the URL.)

  All these environment variables and ones mentioned in the command help can be
  specified in user's configuration file: ~/.hzn/hzn.json with JSON format.
  For example:
  {Com____}

messages.message: The JSON input file name containing the pattern. Mutually exclusive with -p, -b and -B.
messages.translation: Der Name der JSON-Eingabedatei, in der das Muster enthalten ist. Diese Angabe und -p, -b und -B schließen sich gegenseitig aus.

messages.id: Check user input compatibility.
messages.message: Check user input compatibility.
messages.translation: Überprüft die Kompatibilität der Benutzereingabe.

messages.id: The Horizon exchange node ID. Mutually exclusive with --node-ui. If omitted, the node ID that the current device is registered with will be used. If you don't prepend it with the organization id, it will automatically be prepended with the -o value.
messages.message: The Horizon exchange node ID. Mutually exclusive with --node-ui. If omitted, the node ID that the current device is registered with will be used. If you don't prepend it with the organization id, it will automatically be prepended with the -o value.
messages.translation: Die Knoten-ID von Horizon Exchange. Diese Angabe und --node-ui schließen sich gegenseitig aus. Wird diese Option nicht angegeben, wird die Knoten-ID verwendet, mit der die aktuelle Einheit registriert ist. Wenn Sie nicht die Organisations-ID als Präfix hinzufügen, wird automatisch der Wert -o vorangestellt.

messages.id: Development tools for creation of services.
messages.message: Development tools for creation of services.
messages.translation: Entwicklungstools für die Erstellung von Dienstleistungen.

messages.id: Directory containing Horizon project metadata. If omitted, a subdirectory called 'horizon' under current directory will be used.
messages.message: Directory containing Horizon project metadata. If omitted, a subdirectory called 'horizon' under current directory will be used.
messages.translation: Verzeichnis mit Horizon-Projektmetadaten. Wenn nichts angegeben wird, wird ein Unterverzeichnis mit der Bezeichnung 'horizon' im aktuellen Verzeichnis verwendet.

messages.id: For working with project dependencies.
messages.message: For working with project dependencies.
messages.translation: Für die Arbeit mit Projektabhängigkeiten.

messages.id: The URL of the service dependency in the Exchange. Mutually exclusive with -p and --url.
messages.message: The URL of the service dependency in the Exchange. Mutually exclusive with -p and --url.
messages.translation: Die URL der Serviceabhängigkeit im Exchange. Diese Angabe und -p und --url schließen sich gegenseitig aus.

messages.id: The URL of the service dependency in the Exchange. Mutually exclusive with -p and --specRef.
messages.message: The URL of the service dependency in the Exchange. Mutually exclusive with -p and --specRef.
messages.translation: Die URL der Serviceabhängigkeit im Exchange. Diese Angabe und -p und --specRef schließen sich gegenseitig aus.

messages.id: The Org of the service dependency in the Exchange. Mutually exclusive with -p.
messages.message: The Org of the service dependency in the Exchange. Mutually exclusive with -p.
messages.translation: Die Organisation (org) der Serviceabhängigkeit im Exchange. Diese Angabe und -p schließen sich gegenseitig aus.

messages.id: (optional) The Version of the service dependency in the Exchange. Mutually exclusive with -p.
messages.message: (optional) The Version of the service dependency in the Exchange. Mutually exclusive with -p.
messages.translation: (Optional) Die Version der Serviceabhängigkeit im Exchange. Diese Angabe und -p schließen sich gegenseitig aus.

messages.id: (optional) The hardware Architecture of the service dependency in the Exchange. Mutually exclusive with -p.
messages.message: (optional) The hardware Architecture of the service dependency in the Exchange. Mutually exclusive with -p.
messages.translation: (Optional) Die Hardwarearchitektur der Serviceabhängigkeit im Exchange. Diese Angabe und -p schließen sich gegenseitig aus.

messages.id: Retrieving Horizon metadata for a new dependency.
messages.message: Retrieving Horizon metadata for a new dependency.
messages.translation: Zum Abrufen der Horizon-Metadaten für eine neue Abhängigkeit.

messages.id: Horizon project containing the definition of a dependency. Mutually exclusive with -s -o --ver -a and --url.
messages.message: Horizon project containing the definition of a dependency. Mutually exclusive with -s -o --ver -a and --url.
messages.translation: Horizon-Projekt, in dem die Definition einer Abhängigkeit enthalten ist. Diese Angabe und -s -o --ver -a und --url schließen sich gegenseitig aus.

messages.id: Horizon Exchange user credentials to query exchange resources. The default is HZN_EXCHANGE_USER_AUTH environment variable. If you don't prepend it with the user's org, it will automatically be prepended with the value of the HZN_ORG_ID environment variable.
messages.message: Horizon Exchange user credentials to query exchange resources. The default is HZN_EXCHANGE_USER_AUTH environment variable. If you don't prepend it with the user's org, it will automatically be prepended with the value of the HZN_ORG_ID environment variable.
messages.translation: Horizon Exchange-Benutzerberechtigungen zum Abfragen der Exchange-Ressourcen. Die Standardeinstellung ist die Umgebungsvariable HZN_EXCHANGE_USER_AUTH. Wenn Sie nicht die Organisation des Benutzers als Präfix hinzufügen, wird automatisch der Wert der Umgebungsvariablen HZN_ORG_ID vorangestellt.

messages.id: File containing user input values for configuring the new dependency. If omitted, the userinput file in the dependency project will be used.
messages.message: File containing user input values for configuring the new dependency. If omitted, the userinput file in the dependency project will be used.
messages.translation: Die Datei, in der Benutzereingabewerte zum Konfigurieren einer neuen Abhängigkeit enthalten sind. Wenn nichts angegeben wird, wird die Benutzereingabedatei im abhängigen Projekt verwendet.

messages.id: List all dependencies.
messages.message: List all dependencies.
messages.translation: Listet alle Abhängigkeiten auf.

messages.id: Remove a project dependency.
messages.message: Remove a project dependency.
messages.translation: Entfernt eine Projektabhängigkeit.

messages.id: For working with a service project.
messages.message: For working with a service project.
messages.translation: Für die Arbeit mit einem Serviceprojekt.

messages.id: Show the container/system logs for a service.
messages.message: Show the container/system logs for a service.
messages.translation: Zeigt die Container- bzw. Systemprotokolle für einen Service an.

messages.id: The name of the service whose log records should be displayed. The service name is the same as the url field of a service definition.
messages.message: The name of the service whose log records should be displayed. The service name is the same as the url field of a service definition.
messages.translation: Der Name des Service, dessen Protokollsätze angezeigt werden sollen. Der Servicename ist mit dem URL-Feld einer Servicedefinition identisch.

messages.id: (DEPRECATED) This flag is deprecated and is replaced by -c.
messages.message: (DEPRECATED) This flag is deprecated and is replaced by -c.
messages.translation: (VERALTET) Dieses Flag ist veraltet und wurde durch -c ersetzt.

messages.id: The name of the service container whose log records should be displayed. Can be omitted if the service definition has only one container in its deployment config.
messages.message: The name of the service container whose log records should be displayed. Can be omitted if the service definition has only one container in its deployment config.
messages.translation: Der Name des Service-Containers, dessen Protokollsätze angezeigt werden sollen. Diese Angabe kann weggelassen werden, wenn die Bereitstellungskonfiguration der Servicedefinition nur einen Container enthält.

messages.id: Continuously polls the service's logs to display the most recent records, similar to tail -F behavior.
messages.message: Continuously polls the service's logs to display the most recent records, similar to tail -F behavior.
messages.translation: Fragt die Protokolle des Service fortlaufend ab und zeigt die neuesten Datensätze an. Das Verhalten ist ähnlich wie das des Befehls 'tail -F'.

messages.id: Create a new service project.
messages.message: Create a new service project.
messages.translation: Erstellt ein neues Serviceprojekt.

messages.id: The Org id that the service is defined within. If this flag is omitted, the HZN_ORG_ID environment variable is used.
messages.message: The Org id that the service is defined within. If this flag is omitted, the HZN_ORG_ID environment variable is used.
messages.translation: Die ID der Organisation, in der der Service definiert ist. Wenn dieses Flag weggelassen wird, wird die Umgebungsvariable HZN_ORG_ID verwendet.

messages.id: The name of the service. If this flag and the -i flag are omitted, only the skeletal horizon metadata files will be generated.
messages.message: The name of the service. If this flag and the -i flag are omitted, only the skeletal horizon metadata files will be generated.
messages.translation: Der Name des Service. Wenn dieses Flag und das Flag -i weggelassen werden, werden nur die grundlegenden Horizon-Metadatendateien generiert.

messages.id: The version of the service. If this flag is omitted, '0.0.1' is used.
messages.message: The version of the service. If this flag is omitted, '0.0.1' is used.
messages.translation: Die Version des Service. Wenn dieses Flag weggelassen wird, wird '0.0.1' verwendet.

messages.id: The docker container image base name without the version tag for the service. This command will add arch and version to the base name to form the final image name. The format is 'basename_arch:serviceversion'. This flag can be repeated to specify multiple images when '--noImageGen' flag is specified. This flag is ignored for the '--dconfig {KUBEDEPLOYMENTCONFIGTYPE}' deployment configuration.
messages.message: The docker container image base name without the version tag for the service. This command will add arch and version to the base name to form the final image name. The format is 'basename_arch:serviceversion'. This flag can be repeated to specify multiple images when '--noImageGen' flag is specified. This flag is ignored for the '--dconfig {KUBEDEPLOYMENTCONFIGTYPE}' deployment configuration.
messages.translation: Der Basisname des Docker-Container-Image ohne das Versionstag für den Service. Durch diesen Befehl werden zum Basisnamen Angaben für Architektur und Version hinzugefügt; mit diesen Angaben wird der endgültige Imagename erstellt. Das Format lautet 'basisname_architektur:serviceversion'. Dieses Flag kann wiederholt werden, um mehrere Images anzugeben, wenn das Flag '--noImageGen' angegeben ist. Dieses Flag wird für die Bereitstellungskonfiguration '--dconfig {KUBEDEPLOYMENTCONFIGTYPE}' ignoriert.

messages.id: Indicates that the image is built somewhere else. No image sample code will be created by this command. If this flag is not specified, files for generating a simple service image will be created under current directory.
messages.message: Indicates that the image is built somewhere else. No image sample code will be created by this command. If this flag is not specified, files for generating a simple service image will be created under current directory.
messages.translation: Gibt an, dass das Image an einer anderen Position erstellt wird. Bei Verwendung dieses Befehls wird kein Beispielcode für das Image erstellt. Falls dieses Flag nicht angegeben wird, werden die Dateien zum Generieren eines Beispielserviceimage im aktuellen Verzeichnis erstellt.

messages.id: Indicates no pattern definition file will be created.
messages.message: Indicates no pattern definition file will be created.
messages.translation: Bedeutet, dass keine Musterdefinitionsdatei erstellt wird.

messages.id: Indicate no policy file will be created.
messages.message: Indicate no policy file will be created.
messages.translation: Bedeutet, dass keine Richtliniendatei erstellt wird.

messages.id: Indicates the type of deployment configuration that will be used, native (the default), or {KUBEDEPLOYMENTCONFIGTYPE}. This flag can be specified more than once to create a service with more than 1 kind of deployment configuration.
messages.message: Indicates the type of deployment configuration that will be used, native (the default), or {KUBEDEPLOYMENTCONFIGTYPE}. This flag can be specified more than once to create a service with more than 1 kind of deployment configuration.
messages.translation: Gibt den Typ der Bereitstellungskonfiguration an, die verwendet werden soll: 'native' (Standardeinstellung) oder '{KUBEDEPLOYMENTCONFIGTYPE}'. Dieses Flag kann mehrmals angegeben werden, um einen Service mit mehreren Arten von Bereitstellungskonfigurationen zu erstellen.

messages.id: Run a service in a mocked Horizon Agent environment. This command is not supported for services using the {KUBEDEPLOYMENTCONFIGTYPE} deployment configuration.
messages.message: Run a service in a mocked Horizon Agent environment. This command is not supported for services using the {KUBEDEPLOYMENTCONFIGTYPE} deployment configuration.
messages.translation: Führt einen Service in einer Umgebung mit einem simulierten Horizon-Agenten aus. Dieser Befehl wird für Services, die die Bereitstellungskonfiguration {KUBEDEPLOYMENTCONFIGTYPE} verwenden, nicht unterstützt.

messages.id: File containing user input values for running a test. If omitted, the userinput file for the project will be used.
messages.message: File containing user input values for running a test. If omitted, the userinput file for the project will be used.
messages.translation: Datei, in der Benutzereingabewerte zum Ausführen eines Tests enthalten sind. Wenn nichts angegeben wird, wird die Benutzereingabedatei für das Projekt verwendet.

messages.id: File to be made available through the sync service APIs. This flag can be repeated to populate multiple files.
messages.message: File to be made available through the sync service APIs. This flag can be repeated to populate multiple files.
messages.translation: Datei, die über die APIs für den Synchronisationsservice verfügbar gemacht werden soll. Dieses Flag kann wiederholt werden, um mehrere Dateien mit Daten zu füllen.

messages.id: The type of file to be made available through the sync service APIs. All config files are presumed to be of the same type. This flag is required if any configFiles are specified.
messages.message: The type of file to be made available through the sync service APIs. All config files are presumed to be of the same type. This flag is required if any configFiles are specified.
messages.translation: Der Typ der Datei, die über die APIs für den Synchronisationsservice verfügbar gemacht werden soll. Es wird davon ausgegangen, dass alle Konfigurationsdatei denselben Typ aufweisen. Dieses Flag ist erforderlich, wenn Konfigurationsdateien angegeben sind.

messages.id: Do not bring up file sync service (FSS) containers. They are brought up by default.
messages.message: Do not bring up file sync service (FSS) containers. They are brought up by default.
messages.translation: Starten Sie nicht Container für den Dateisynchronisationsservice (File Sync Service, FSS). Sie werden standardmäßig gestartet.

messages.id: Horizon Exchange user credentials to query exchange resources. Specify it when you want to automatically fetch the missing dependent services from the Exchange. The default is HZN_EXCHANGE_USER_AUTH environment variable. If you don't prepend it with the user's org, it will automatically be prepended with the value of the HZN_ORG_ID environment variable.
messages.message: Horizon Exchange user credentials to query exchange resources. Specify it when you want to automatically fetch the missing dependent services from the Exchange. The default is HZN_EXCHANGE_USER_AUTH environment variable. If you don't prepend it with the user's org, it will automatically be prepended with the value of the HZN_ORG_ID environment variable.
messages.translation: Horizon Exchange-Benutzerberechtigungen zum Abfragen der Exchange-Ressourcen. Geben Sie sie an, wenn die fehlenden abhängigen Services automatisch von Exchange abgerufen werden sollen. Die Standardeinstellung ist die Umgebungsvariable HZN_EXCHANGE_USER_AUTH. Wenn Sie nicht die Organisation des Benutzers als Präfix hinzufügen, wird automatisch der Wert der Umgebungsvariablen HZN_ORG_ID vorangestellt.

messages.id: Filepath of a file containing a secret that is required by the service or one of its dependent services. The filename must match a secret name in the service definition. The file is encoded in JSON as an object containing two keys both typed as a string; "key" is used to indicate the kind of secret, and "value" is the string form of the secret. This flag can be repeated.
messages.message: Filepath of a file containing a secret that is required by the service or one of its dependent services. The filename must match a secret name in the service definition. The file is encoded in JSON as an object containing two keys both typed as a string; "key" is used to indicate the kind of secret, and "value" is the string form of the secret. This flag can be repeated.
messages.translation: Der Dateipfad einer Datei mit einem geheimen Schlüssel, der für den Service oder einen seiner abhängigen Services erforderlich ist. Der Dateiname muss mit dem Namen eines geheimen Schlüssels in der Servicedefinition übereinstimmen. Die Datei ist in JSON als Objekt codiert das zwei Schlüssel mit dem Datentyp 'String' enthält; "schlüssel" wird zur Angabe des Typs des geheimen Schlüssels verwendet und "wert" ist die Zeichenfolgeform des geheimen Schlüssels. Dieses Flag kann mehrmals angegeben werden.

messages.id: Stop a service that is running in a mocked Horizon Agent environment. This command is not supported for services using the {KUBEDEPLOYMENTCONFIGTYPE} deployment configuration.
messages.message: Stop a service that is running in a mocked Horizon Agent environment. This command is not supported for services using the {KUBEDEPLOYMENTCONFIGTYPE} deployment configuration.
messages.translation: Stoppt einen Service, der in einer Umgebung mit einem simulierten Horizon-Agenten ausgeführt wird. Dieser Befehl wird für Services, die die Bereitstellungskonfiguration {KUBEDEPLOYMENTCONFIGTYPE} verwenden, nicht unterstützt.

messages.id: Validate the project for completeness and schema compliance.
messages.message: Validate the project for completeness and schema compliance.
messages.translation: Überprüft das Projekt auf Vollständigkeit und Schemakonformität.

messages.id: File containing user input values for verification of a project. If omitted, the userinput file for the project will be used.
messages.message: File containing user input values for verification of a project. If omitted, the userinput file for the project will be used.
messages.translation: Datei, in der Benutzereingabewerte zum Überprüfen eines Projekts enthalten sind. Wenn nichts angegeben wird, wird die Benutzereingabedatei für das Projekt verwendet.

messages.id: Show the Horizon Environment Variables.
messages.message: Show the Horizon Environment Variables.
messages.translation: Zeigt die Umgebungsvariablen für Horizon an.

messages.id: List the event logs for the current or all registrations.
messages.message: List the event logs for the current or all registrations.
messages.translation: Listet die Ereignisprotokolle für die aktuelle Registrierung oder alle Registrierungen auf.

messages.id: Continuously polls the event log to display the most recent records, similar to tail -F behavior.
messages.message: Continuously polls the event log to display the most recent records, similar to tail -F behavior.
messages.translation: Fragt die Ereignisprotokollle fortlaufend ab und zeigt die neuesten Datensätze an. Das Verhalten ist ähnlich wie das des Befehls 'tail -F'.

messages.id: List all the event logs including the previous registrations.
messages.message: List all the event logs including the previous registrations.
messages.translation: Listet alle Ereignisprotokolle einschließlich der vorherigen Registrierungen auf.

messages.id: List event logs with details.
messages.message: List event logs with details.
messages.translation: Listet die Ereignisprotokolle mit Details auf.

messages.id: Selection string. This flag can be repeated which means 'AND'. Each flag should be in the format of attribute=value, attribute~value, "attribute>value" or "attribute<value", where '~' means contains. The common attribute names are timestamp, severity, message, event_code, source_type, agreement_id, service_url etc. Use the '-l' flag to see all the attribute names.
messages.message: Selection string. This flag can be repeated which means 'AND'. Each flag should be in the format of attribute=value, attribute~value, "attribute>value" or "attribute<value", where '~' means contains. The common attribute names are timestamp, severity, message, event_code, source_type, agreement_id, service_url etc. Use the '-l' flag to see all the attribute names.
messages.translation: Auswahlzeichenfolge. Dieses Flag kann wiederholt werden, was als 'AND' zu interpretieren ist. Jedes Flag muss das Format 'attribut=wert', 'attribut~wert, '"attribut>wert"' oder '"attribut<wert"' aufweisen; hierbei bedeutet '~', dass der Wert enthalten ist. Allgemeine Attributnamen sind 'timestamp', 'severity', 'message', 'event_code', 'source_type', 'agreement_id', 'service_url' etc; verwenden Sie das Flag '-l', um alle Attributnamen anzuzeigen.

messages.id: List all the active errors that will be shared with the Exchange if the node is online.
messages.message: List all the active errors that will be shared with the Exchange if the node is online.
messages.translation: Listet alle aktiven Fehler auf, die mit dem Exchange geteilt werden, wenn der Knoten online ist.

messages.id: List the full event logs of the surface errors.
messages.message: List the full event logs of the surface errors.
messages.translation: Listet die vollständigen Ereignisprotokolle der aufgetretenen Fehler auf.

messages.id: List and manage Horizon Exchange resources.
messages.message: List and manage Horizon Exchange resources.
messages.translation: Listet die Ressourcen von Horizon Exchange auf und verwaltet sie.

messages.id: Horizon Exchange user credentials to query and create exchange resources. If not specified, HZN_EXCHANGE_USER_AUTH will be used as a default. If you don't prepend it with the user's org, it will automatically be prepended with the -o value. As an alternative to using -o, you can set HZN_ORG_ID with the Horizon exchange organization ID
messages.message: Horizon Exchange user credentials to query and create exchange resources. If not specified, HZN_EXCHANGE_USER_AUTH will be used as a default. If you don't prepend it with the user's org, it will automatically be prepended with the -o value. As an alternative to using -o, you can set HZN_ORG_ID with the Horizon exchange organization ID
messages.translation: Horizon Exchange-Benutzerberechtigungen zum Abfragen und Erstellen der Exchange-Ressourcen. Werden keine angegeben, wird standardmäßig HZN_EXCHANGE_USER_AUTH verwendet. Wenn Sie nicht die Organisation des Benutzers als Präfix hinzufügen, wird automatisch der Wert -o vorangestellt. Als Alternative zur Verwendung von -o können Sie für HZN_ORG_ID die Organisations-ID von Horizon Exchange festlegen.

messages.id: List and manage agbots in the Horizon Exchange
messages.message: List and manage agbots in the Horizon Exchange
messages.translation: Listet die Agbots in Horizon Exchange auf und verwaltet sie.

messages.id: Add this deployment policy to the list of policies this agbot is serving. Currently only support adding all the deployment policies from an organization.
messages.message: Add this deployment policy to the list of policies this agbot is serving. Currently only support adding all the deployment policies from an organization.
messages.translation: Fügt diese Bereitstellungsrichtlinie zur Liste der Richtlinien hinzu, die von diesem Agbot bereitgestellt werden. Derzeit wird nur das Hinzufügen aller Bereitstellungsrichtlinien von einer Organisation unterstützt.

messages.id: The agbot to add the deployment policy to.
messages.message: The agbot to add the deployment policy to.
messages.translation: Der Agbot, dem die Bereitstellungsrichtlinie hinzugefügt werden soll.

messages.id: The organization of the deployment policy to add.
messages.message: The organization of the deployment policy to add.
messages.translation: Die Organisation der Bereitstellungsrichtlinie, die hinzugefügt werden soll.

messages.id: Add this pattern to the list of patterns this agbot is serving.
messages.message: Add this pattern to the list of patterns this agbot is serving.
messages.translation: Fügt dieses Muster zur Liste der Muster hinzu, die von diesem Agbot bereitgestellt werden.

messages.id: The agbot to add the pattern to.
messages.message: The agbot to add the pattern to.
messages.translation: Der Agbot, zu dem das Muster hinzugefügt werden soll.

messages.id: The organization of the pattern to add.
messages.message: The organization of the pattern to add.
messages.translation: Die Organisation des Musters, das hinzugefügt werden soll.

messages.id: The name of the pattern to add.
messages.message: The name of the pattern to add.
messages.translation: Der Name des Musters, das hinzugefügt werden soll.

messages.id: The organization of the nodes that should be searched. Defaults to patternorg.
messages.message: The organization of the nodes that should be searched. Defaults to patternorg.
messages.translation: Die Organisation der Knoten, die durchsucht werden sollen. Standardwert ist 'patternorg'.

messages.id: Display the agbot resources from the Horizon Exchange.
messages.message: Display the agbot resources from the Horizon Exchange.
messages.translation: Zeigt die Agbot-Ressourcen in Horizon Exchange an.

messages.id: List just this one agbot.
messages.message: List just this one agbot.
messages.translation: Listet nur diesen einen Agbot auf.

messages.id: When listing all of the agbots, show the entire resource of each agbots, instead of just the name.
messages.message: When listing all of the agbots, show the entire resource of each agbots, instead of just the name.
messages.translation: Wenn alle Agbots aufgelistet werden, wird anstatt des Namens die gesamte Ressource jedes einzelnen Agbots angezeigt.

messages.id: Display the deployment policies that this agbot is serving.
messages.message: Display the deployment policies that this agbot is serving.
messages.translation: Zeigt die Bereitstellungsrichtlinien an, die von diesem Agbot bereitgestellt werden.

messages.id: The agbot to list serving deployment policies for.
messages.message: The agbot to list serving deployment policies for.
messages.translation: Der Agbot, für den die bereitgestellten Bereitstellungsrichtlinien aufgelistet werden sollen.

messages.id: Display the patterns that this agbot is serving.
messages.message: Display the patterns that this agbot is serving.
messages.translation: Zeigt die Muster an, die von diesem Agbot bereitgestellt werden.

messages.id: The agbot to list the patterns for.
messages.message: The agbot to list the patterns for.
messages.translation: Der Agbot, für den die Muster aufgelistet werden sollen.

messages.id: The organization of the 1 pattern to list.
messages.message: The organization of the 1 pattern to list.
messages.translation: Die Organisation des einen Musters, das aufgelistet werden soll.

messages.id: The name of the 1 pattern to list.
messages.message: The name of the 1 pattern to list.
messages.translation: Der Name des einen Musters, das aufgelistet werden soll.

messages.id: Remove this deployment policy from the list of policies this agbot is serving. Currently only support removing all the deployment policies from an organization.
messages.message: Remove this deployment policy from the list of policies this agbot is serving. Currently only support removing all the deployment policies from an organization.
messages.translation: Entfernt diese Bereitstellungsrichtlinie aus der Liste der Richtlinien, die von diesem Agbot bereitgestellt werden. Derzeit wird nur das Entfernen aller Bereitstellungsrichtlinien aus einer Organisation unterstützt.

messages.id: The agbot to remove the deployment policy from.
messages.message: The agbot to remove the deployment policy from.
messages.translation: Der Agbot, aus dem die Bereitstellungsrichtlinie entfernt werden soll.

messages.id: The organization of the deployment policy to remove.
messages.message: The organization of the deployment policy to remove.
messages.translation: Die Organisation der Bereitstellungsrichtlinie, die entfernt werden soll.

messages.id: Remove this pattern from the list of patterns this agbot is serving.
messages.message: Remove this pattern from the list of patterns this agbot is serving.
messages.translation: Entfernt dieses Muster aus der Liste der Muster, die von diesem Agbot bereitgestellt werden.

messages.id: The agbot to remove the pattern from.
messages.message: The agbot to remove the pattern from.
messages.translation: Der Agbot, von dem das Muster entfernt werden soll.

messages.id: The organization of the pattern to remove.
messages.message: The organization of the pattern to remove.
messages.translation: Die Organisation des Musters, das entfernt werden soll.

messages.id: The name of the pattern to remove.
messages.message: The name of the pattern to remove.
messages.translation: Der Name des Musters, das entfernt werden soll.

messages.id: List all public services/patterns in all orgs that have orgType: IBM.
messages.message: List all public services/patterns in all orgs that have orgType: IBM.
messages.translation: Listet alle Services/Muster in allen Organisationen auf, die als Organisationstyp 'IBM' aufweisen (orgType: IBM).

messages.id: Display all public patterns in all orgs that have orgType: IBM.
messages.message: Display all public patterns in all orgs that have orgType: IBM.
messages.translation: Zeigt alle öffentlichen Muster in allen Organisationen an, die den Organisationstyp 'IBM' aufweisen (orgType: IBM).

messages.id: Only display org (IBM) and pattern names.
messages.message: Only display org (IBM) and pattern names.
messages.translation: Zeigt nur die Organisation (IBM) und die Musternamen an.

messages.id: Display detailed output about public patterns in all orgs that have orgType: IBM.
